Description: Perforated disk or spindle whorl made from a fragment of Black-top red pot with a rippled and red burnished exterior, and a black polished interior. The edges are roughly chipped and smoothed; the boring is central.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (p. 8, 34)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
